qas.question: In what year were the first streetcars used in Seattle?
What machine caused the end of city rail lines in Seattle?
When did the Tacoma-Seattle rail service end?
In what year did the Everett-Seattle rail lines cease?
The use of what caused the end of the use of streetcars in 1941?

context: The first streetcars appeared in <a0_0>1889<a0_0/> and were instrumental in the creation of a relatively well-defined downtown and strong neighborhoods at the end of their lines. The advent of the <a1_0>automobile<a1_0/> sounded the death knell for rail in Seattle. Tacoma–Seattle railway service ended in <a2_0>1929<a2_0/> and the Everett–Seattle service came to an end in <a3_0>1939<a3_0/>, replaced by inexpensive automobiles running on the recently developed highway system. Rails on city streets were paved over or removed, and the opening of the Seattle <a4_0>trolleybus<a4_0/> system brought the end of streetcars in Seattle in 1941. This left an extensive network of privately owned buses (later public) as the only mass transit within the city and throughout the region.
